data.title: Great Experience
data.text: Warehouse atmosphere brewery that acts like a community social with events such as live music and movie night.  There was a large baby shower going on while we were there.  There is an impressive array of unique brews the cover the entire taste spectrum.  As such, I recommend ordering a 4 sample flight or two.  At $10 a flight, you can sample multiple options from the dozen or more beers that are available and see which ones suit your palette. Very friendly staff, even though they were over worked trying to keep up with the crowd on a Sunday afternoon.

data.title: Solid line up of beers
data.text: We sampled an array of beer styles. Each was well executed. The staff was friendly and helpful.  I am not sure if their beers available outside of the area, but I will be keeping an eye out for it.

data.title: Great Downtown Location
data.text: The brewery is located downtown within easy walking distance of almost everything.  There are plenty of bar and table seats.  The beer is a great selection and the flights are generously poured.  The food options are limited to snacks, etc… so you may want to bring your own.  There is plenty of free parking on the street.

data.title: nice brewpub
data.text:
very nice employees very good beer and good selection.
know the difference between 1st street and 1st ave when looking for

data.title: Interesting Beer And Strange Food - Highly Recommended
data.text: They brew their own beer so that's nice. It's decent and prices are average for downtown. The food is mostly appetizer quality but you can order/bring in food from other places and there are plenty eateries within a 3 block radius. There are quite a few events going on each week - something for everyone - movie nights, trivia, brewery tour, etc.

data.title: Beer ok,  fun atmosphere
data.text: Plenty of games for entertainment but beer was not our favorite. Fun atmosphere, nice staff but can't rave about the beer

data.title: Brewery tour
data.text: This will stop number two on my brewery tour on Friday night. After finding a place to park street side I was able to quickly walk in and get a drink and have a seat. There was live music playing on this evening. There is a limited sandwich and appetizer menus for those who may stay a bit longer.  Beverages were amazing and service was amazing, especially the girls pulling the drafts!

data.title: Just the place for a beer and sandwich
data.text: There's some good beer here and the menu is small but contains some unusual and very good grilled cheese sandwiches.

data.title: Good beer, good fun
data.text: My husband enjoys local brews when traveling, so this was a must-do stop. We went on a Friday evening. There was room to sit at either the bar or a table. It was apparent that as some poeple came in that they were known by the wait staff and bartenders. There is a table with various board games and cards. Over on a side wall, you could play corn hole. There was live entertainment that evening as well. We played some card games, enjoyed free popcorn, and enjoyed some really good beer. What's not to like?

data.title: Beer Enthusiasts
data.text: We stopped in for local beer in the afternoon and we were not disappointed. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable, and passionate about their craft. The Igors Horn was our personal favorite, but there is a wide selection to taste. They were setting up for live music and said they just want to serve good beer, so people can hang out with ordered in food and whatever they'd like.

data.title: A+
data.text: Here on business from Michigan and was having a hard time finding craft beers at local beer stores. I thankfully ran into Drekker and was more than impressed.  Broken Rudder and Hell Bent were two of my favorites.  Highly recommended. The ladies behind the bar were super nice!

data.title: Great beer and service!
data.text: The Porter was amazing and smooth. We tried and few others and they were also really good. The have a few food items but it is mostly about the beer! The staff was great!

data.title: Really nice brew selections
data.text: Obviously a local favorite this brewery has not been open long. Good service and selections. A drinking place. Not an eating place but they have a small selection of bar food. Funky and fun.

data.title: Downtown Brewery
data.text: An amazing selection of their own craft beers. Staff was very knowledgeable. Live music and great beer are a great combination.

data.title: Best brewery in F/M area
data.text: Was glad to have finally had a chance to return here. Fantastic beers in a friendly tap room.  Beertenders know what they are serving and a very welcoming.  Beer quality and selection continues to mature.  Look forward to passing through again to see how they are growing and evolving.

data.title: always worth a stop
data.text:
I live 4 hours away and will always stop for a beer when I am close.
The beers have never disappointed. This trip was the first time my daughter was 
old enough to join me and wish as a father, there were more times like introducing 
your kid to a great new beer or venue. Walk up to the bar and ask your questions,
order your beer, and enjoy. They have your typical craft brew tap room games, bean bag
toss, jenga and yoga????
They are in a vibrate area with good parking and activities in the area.

data.title: Good beers with fun games
data.text:
Ok, if you are looking for a brewery experience check out Fargo Brewing Company, but if you are looking for a fun place to hang out for the entire evening - Drekker is your place.

The only reason I didn't rate it a 5 is the service - I didn't find it particularly friendly or helpful in trying to select a beer to sample. It was run as a bar and not a brewery (In my opinion).. So it all depends on the experience you are after - I was after the latter.

I went on a Tuesday night and it was full of college aged people who came to hang out with their friends and play some corn hole - so its a busy and fun atmosphere.

There's limited seating because of all the games and no food on site BUT there are plenty of restaurants nearby/next door and Drekker encourages you to get take out and bring back to the brewery. 

I did not see a parking garage but was able to find (free) parking on the street. No idea how hard this will be on a weekend.

data.title: Perfect stop to fill the growlers and howlers on the way to the lake!
data.text: We drive throug Fargo often and we have just gotten in the habit of packing our growlers and howlers to fill at Drekker on our way through.  They have a great variety including fantastic sour beers.  My favorite is the Drive by Glitter Bomb.  There really is something for everyone.  The Techno Viking is a pretty light beer but has great flavor.  We haven't found a beer here yet that we don't like.

data.title: Nice building, good beers
data.text: Beers are good, great building and atmosphere. Wish they had more than grilled cheese and popcorn but hey, I went for the beer. Parking is a treasure hunt....

data.title: Brewery
data.text:
We stopped for the first time. Not sure what to expect, we found a good selection of beer. Prior to ordering, the bartender gave us a few samples. My husband had a flight of 4 & I had one called Hell Bent. If you like a dark beers but one the
At is no heavy, I would recommend it!
